title: Throttle Body and Inlet Manifold Assembly - Installation

body.body: Throttle Body and Inlet Manifold Assembly - Installation
Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
From VIN 783907 the purge valve restrictor has been removed from the purge valve hose. The restriction is now controlled by the purge valve spigot on the inlet manifold.
Fitting a new manifold with the purge valve restrictor in the spigot and using the original hose with a restrictor in it will not allow the carbon cannister to purge correctly.
Failure to purge the carbon cannister correctly will cause irreparable damage to the carbon cannister.
If replacing the inlet manifold on models up to VIN 783906 check the purge control valve hose for the restrictor, approximately 25 mm from the inlet manifold end of the hose.
If the hose has the restrictor, replace the hose with a new hose without the restrictor. Restriction is controlled by the spigot pressed into the new inlet manifold.
When ordering replacement parts, always refer to the EPC.
Ensure the mating surfaces on the inlet manifold and the cylinder head are clean.
Fit three new seals to the mating surfaces of the inlet manifold.
Fit the inlet manifold to the cylinder head. Do not fully tighten the fixings at this stage.
Ensure the mating surfaces of the throttle body and inlet manifold are clean.
Position the throttle body to the throttle body hose. Do not tighten the clamp at this stage.
Fit the throttle body to the inlet manifold. Do not fully tighten the fixings at this stage.
Tighten the inlet manifold to cylinder head fixings to
Retighten the fixings one and two to
Tighten the throttle body to inlet manifold fixings to
Ensure the throttle body hose is correctly fitted and tighten the clip to
Connect the multiplug to the throttle actuator motor.
Connect the MAP hose and the evaporative emissions hose (if fitted) to the inlet manifold, as noted for removal.
Fit the mountings for the air intake finisher and tighten its new fixings to
Fit the air intake finishers and tighten the new fixing to
Air intake finisher (right hand side shown)
Refit the right and left hand side panels DP
